alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Morris; Titus (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 03 at 9:53PM CST until March 07 at 9:00AM CST by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following river in Texas... White Oak Creek Near Talco affecting Franklin, Morris and Titus Counties. For the White Oak Creek...including Talco...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY MORNING TO LATE TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...White Oak Creek Near Talco. * WHEN...From Sunday morning to late Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, Expect minor lowland flooding of creek bottoms. Ranchers that may have cattle and equipment in the creek bottoms should move them to higher ground. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:30 PM CST Friday the stage was 9.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage Sunday morning to a crest of 16.5 feet Sunday evening. It will then fall below flood stage Monday afternoon. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. For more hydrologic information, copy and paste the following website address into your favorite web browser URL bar: water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=shv The next statement will be issued Saturday evening at 1000 PM CST.
